entries.title: Indonesia Sends Warship to Monitor Chinese Coast Guard Vessel

entries.title: Romanian Prosecutors Take Away Luxury Cars Seized in Andrew Tate Case
entries.description: Romanian officials transport the cars seized from Andrew Tate's compound to a storage location in Pipera, Ilfov, Romania, on Jan. 14, 2023. (Inquam Photos/Octav Ganea via Reuters)

entries.title: Chinese Canadians Snatch Up Medicines to Send to China Amid Surging COVID Infections, Drug Shortages
entries.description: People wait in line to buy medicine at a pharmacy in Beijing, China, on Dec. 9, 2022. (Kevin Frayer/Getty Images)

entries.title: Girl, 7, Seriously Hurt and Others Injured in Shooting Near London Church
entries.description: Forensics officers work at the scene of a shooting, the attack reportedly happened during a funeral at St Aloysius Church, in London, Britain, on Jan. 14, 2023. (Henry Nicholls/Reuters)

entries.title: WEF Elites Rate ‘Cost-of-Living Crisis’ as World’s Top Risk in 2 years
entries.description: A sign of the World Economic Forum (WEF) is seen at the Congress centre during its annual meeting in Davos on May 23, 2022. (Fabrice Coffrini/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: Business Optimism Seen for Vancouver’s Gastown Despite Starbucks Closure, Homelessness Issue
entries.description: The former location of the Starbucks in Gastown, Vancouver, is put up for lease after its closure on Dec. 31, 2022. (Jeff Sandes/The Epoch Times)

entries.title: Whatever Happened to Investigations Into 2021 Church Arsons?
entries.description: Firefighters put out hot spots at what remains of St. Jean Baptiste Parish Catholic Church in Morinville, Alta., after a fire on June 30, 2021. (The Canadian Press/Jason Franson)

entries.description: The first British Challenger 2 main battle tanks roll off of their transport ship after arriving from Germany at Camp Commando, Kuwait, in February 2003. (WO2 Giles Penfound/MOD/Getty Images)

entries.title: Virgin Orbit: Premature Shutdown Behind Rocket Launch Fail

entries.title: Paul Johnson, UK Historian and Champion of Thatcher, Dies
entries.description: Historian and journalist Paul Johnson, (L), receives the Presidential Medal of Freedom from United States President Bush during a ceremony in the East Room of the White House on Dec. 15, 2006. (Pablo Martinez Monsivais/AP Photo)

entries.title: Explosion in Gas Pipeline in Lithuania, No Injuries Reported
entries.description: A flame rises after an explosion at a gas pipeline near Pasvalys, 175 km (109 miles) north of Vilnius in northern Lithuania on Friday, Jan. 13, 2023. Officials say an explosion has occurred in a pipeline in central Lithuania carrying natural gas to the north of the country and neighboring Latvia but no supply disruptions or injuries were reported. Baltic media reported that Friday's blast sent flames up to 50 meters (164 feet) into the sky and forced the protective evacuation of a nearby village. (AP Photo/Paulius Zidonis)

entries.title: Djokovic Receives Warm Welcome in Melbourne Return
entries.description: Serbia's Novak Djokovic swings his towel as he dances between games during an exhibition match against Australia's Nick Kyrgios on Rod Laver Arena ahead of the Australian Open tennis championship in Melbourne, Australia, on Jan. 13, 2023. (Mark Baker/AP Photo)

entries.title: Cardinal George Pell: A Lifetime of Achievements
